summary:
In Greek mythology, the Titans were powerful gods who ruled before the Olympians. They were the children of Uranus and Gaia. The most famous Titans include Oceanus, Coeus, and Rhea. Cronus, another Titan, became the ruler after overthrowing his father. He married his sister Rhea, who gave birth to the first Olympians.

The Titans were eventually defeated by Zeus and the Olympians in a great battle called the Titanomachy. After their loss, most Titans were imprisoned in Tartarus, a dark place in the underworld.
title: Titans
